p: Marco et al. obtained calopogonium isoflavone B ( 71) and isoerythrin A-4′-(3-methylbut-2-enyl) ether ( 72) maximaisoflavone B ( 73) and 7,2′-dimethoxy-4′,5′-methylenedioxyisoflavone ( 74) from the root bark of Millettia dura (Leguminosae) harvested in Tanzania [ 82]. These compounds showed marginal activities (70 to 90% inhibition at 40 μM) against the 3D7 and Dd2 strains of P. falciparum.
